Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2009 11:24PM thomasj wrote: Hello, I was one week shy of my 33rd Bday when diagnosed.  I had two children aged 7 & 9.  At the time, they were not even sure what to do with me.  I had a 1.4 cm lump I found myself.  Through my own research, I chose a lumpectomy - very new at the time.  I had 6 weeks of radiation and chose to not have chemo -- was a gray area then - wouldn't be now...it would be recommended.  It will be 20 years in May since my diagnosis.  I have had not further problems and am now a grandmother.  I wish you all the best during this scary time; thought it might be helpful to hear from a looong term survivor.
Posts.Title: just diagnosed at the age of 33 aaronali12 nandy1975

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2011 12:11AM thomasj wrote:  I have been a survivor for 22 years this May.  One week shy of 33 at diagosis and now will be 55.  My sons were 8 and 10 at the time, now 30 and 32 and I am a grandma of a 3 and 1 year old.  I had a very early recurrance on the same side a year ago but had a dmx with reconstruction and doing great.   Best wishes to everyone.
Posts.Title: How many years have you been a Survivor? IllinoisNancy Lou789
